item.title: 美国指控朝鲜人阴谋欺诈 100 多家公司
item.description: 美国司法部宣布逮捕一人，并对另外九人提出指控，他们涉嫌参与一项计划，在该计划中，朝鲜人假扮成美国技术工人，以获得利润丰厚的工作并为朝鲜政府提供资金。【原文：The US Justice Department announced one arrest and charges against nine more people in connection with an alleged scheme in which North Koreans posed as American tech workers to gain lucrative jobs and fund the country’s government.】

item.title: 美国学区在耗尽 Covid 现金后急于出售债券
item.description: 大流行病时期的借贷暂停已经结束。随着联邦援助的耗尽和入学压力的增加，公立学校纷纷涌入市政债券市场，为拖延已久的升级改造提供资金。【原文：The pandemic-era pause on borrowing is over. Public schools are flooding the municipal-bond market to fund long-delayed upgrades as federal aid runs out and enrollment pressures mount.】

item.title: 高盛将美联储降息预测提前至 9 月
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）提前了对美联储降息的预测，现在呼吁央行在 9 月而不是 12 月恢复降息，因为关税对通胀的影响 "看起来比预期的要小一些"。【原文：Goldman Sachs pulled forward its forecast for Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, and is now calling for the central bank to resume reductions in September rather than December, as the inflationary effects of tariffs “look a bit smaller” than expected.】

item.title: 国际刑事法院称已控制住网络事件
item.description: 国际刑事法院在周一的一份声明中说，该组织上周首次发现了一起 "复杂的、有针对性的 "网络安全事件。【原文：The International Criminal Court contained a “sophisticated and targeted” cybersecurity incident that it first identified last week, the organization said in a statement Monday.】

item.title: 扎克伯格宣布 "超级智能 "元计划和更多招聘信息
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc.首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）宣布对公司的人工智能部门进行重大重组，包括致力于开发人工智能 "超级智能"（superintelligence），即能够像人类一样甚至比人类更好地完成任务的系统。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg announced a major restructuring of the company’s artificial intelligence group, including a commitment to developing AI “superintelligence,” or systems that can complete tasks as well as or even better than humans.】

item.title: 美国法官裁定阿根廷必须交出 YPF 51% 的股份
item.description: 一名美国法官周一命令阿根廷交出其在国营石油公司 YPF SA 的控股权，作为对拉美国家 160 亿美元法庭判决的部分赔偿。【原文：A US judge on Monday ordered Argentina to turn over its controlling stake in the state-run oil company YPF SA as partial payment of a $16 billion court judgment against the Latin American country.】

item.title: 肯尼亚通胀率稳定在 3.8%，水电成本下降
item.description: 由于公用事业和住房价格增长放缓，肯尼亚 6 月份的年通货膨胀率持平。【原文：Kenya’s annual inflation rate flatlined in June helped by slower growth in utilities and housing prices.】

item.title: 尽管征收关税，美国 4 月柴油需求仍比预期强劲
item.description: 美国能源信息署在其月度报告中称，作为衡量美国经济健康状况的一个受到密切关注的指标，美国 4 月份的柴油需求量高于周初的估计值。【原文：US diesel demand, a closely watched measure of the country’s economic health, was higher in April than early weekly estimates, the Energy Information Administration said in its monthly report.】

item.title: WFAN 所有者 Audacy 与竞争对手 iHeart 签订节目共享协议
item.description: 美国最大的两家广播公司 Audacy Inc. 和 iHeartMedia Inc. 将联手达成一项节目分销协议，旨在覆盖更多听众，更好地与流媒体领军企业 Spotify Technology SA 竞争。【原文：Audacy Inc. and iHeartMedia Inc., the two largest US radio broadcasters, are teaming up in a program distribution deal designed to reach more listeners and better compete with streaming leader Spotify Technology SA.】

item.title: 俄罗斯受制裁的北极液化天然气 2 公司将产量提高到创纪录水平
item.description: 俄罗斯受制裁的北极液化天然气 2 号项目在 6 月的最后几天将产量提高到创纪录的水平，因为该设施似乎已恢复装货。【原文：Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project raised production to record levels during the last days of June as the facility appears to have resumed loading cargoes.】

item.title: 欧盟与乌克兰达成新贸易协议，免关税制度终结
item.description: 欧盟与乌克兰达成了一项新的贸易安排，以取代俄罗斯全面入侵后实施的特别免关税制度。【原文：The European Union reached a new trade arrangement with Ukraine to replace the special tariff-free regime that was put in place in the wake of Russia’s full-scale invasion.】

item.title: 智利在市场供应紧张的情况下实现今年最大铜产量
item.description: 智利公布了今年铜产量最高的一个月，全球最大的铜金属供应国为紧张的全球市场带来了一些缓解。【原文：Chile posted its best month of copper production this year as the world’s largest supplier of the metal delivers some relief to tight global markets.】

item.title: 加拿大屈服于特朗普压力后，英国坚守数字税立场
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士称，在加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）为重启与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）政府的贸易谈判而取消了本国的数字服务税之后，英国目前正计划保留其数字服务税。【原文：The UK is currently planning to keep its digital services tax, a person familiar with the matter said, after Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney scrapped their own levy to restart trade talks with President Donald Trump’s administration.】

item.title: StoneX 拟收购深陷美国毒品索赔案的银行股份
item.description: 斯通克斯集团公司（StoneX Group Inc.【原文：StoneX Group Inc. said it’s seeking to acquire US units of Mexican bank Intercam Banco SA, which last week was among three firms accused by the Trump administration of facilitating money laundering for drug traffickers.】

item.title: 政界和商界甚至不再努力
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 敦促欧盟企业在 T+1 转变之前实现贸易流程自动化
item.description: 负责监督向更快的贸易结算制度过渡的欧洲机构敦促企业投资自动化，并表示改用所谓的 T+1 将增加该地区市场的吸引力。【原文：The European body charged with overseeing the transition to a faster trade settlement regime urged firms to invest in automation, saying that the switch to what’s known as T+1 will increase the attractiveness of the region’s markets.】

item.title: 加拿大取消数字税后，油菜籽因需求旺盛而跳涨
item.description: 在加拿大政府表示取消数字税以重启与美国的更广泛贸易协议谈判之后，油菜籽期货攀升了3.2%，创下两周来的最大盘中涨幅。【原文：Canola futures climbed as much as 3.2% — the biggest intraday gain in two weeks — after the Canadian government said it scrapped a digital tax in an effort to restart talks on a broader trade deal with the US.】

item.title: 荷兰推迟对 TenneT 的德国电网交易做出决定
item.description: 荷兰政府需要更多时间来评估 TenneT Holding BV 德国高压电业务的选择方案，并可能在 9 月份做出决定。【原文：The Dutch government needs more time to assess the options for TenneT Holding BV’s German high-voltage business and a decision is likely to come in September.】

item.title: Robinhood 为欧洲交易者增加区块链上的美国股票
item.description: Robinhood Markets 公司加入了在区块链上交易美国股票的行列，为 30 个国家的 15 万客户提供每周五天、每天 24 小时的代币化美国证券交易。【原文：Robinhood Markets Inc. is joining the growing push to trade US equities on the blockchain, making tokenized US securities available to 150,000 customers in 30 countries, 24 hours a day, five days a week.】

item.title: 美联储博斯蒂克称关税传导可能缓慢而持久
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行行长拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）表示，关税可能会对价格产生渐进式影响，而不是一次性冲击，这可能会导致通胀面临更持久的上升压力。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said tariffs may cause an incremental impact on prices instead of a one-time bump, which could result in more persistent upward pressure on inflation.】

item.title: DailyPay 销售与工资费用挂钩的债券，工人可即时支取
item.description: 金融科技公司 DailyPay Inc. 本月出售了 2 亿美元的债券，这些债券由与该公司主要服务相关的费用支持。【原文：Fintech company DailyPay Inc. this month sold $200 million of bonds backed by fees tied to the company’s main service, an app that lets workers access pay as soon as they’ve earned it rather than wait for paychecks.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利调整科技投行领导层
item.description: 摩根士丹利任命德鲁-格瓦拉（Drew Guevara）为技术投资银行全球联席主管，这是对这家华尔街银行最富传奇色彩的专营机构进行更广泛调整的一部分。【原文：Morgan Stanley has appointed Drew Guevara as a global co-head of technology investment banking as part of a broader reshuffle of one of the Wall Street bank’s most storied franchises.】

item.title: 美国警告与伊朗有关的黑客对美国公司构成持续风险
item.description: 美国联邦调查局（FBI）、国家安全局、网络安全和基础设施安全局以及国防网络犯罪中心周一发布公告称，与伊朗有关联的黑客仍对美国经济的关键部门构成潜在威胁，其中包括国防承包商和其他美国组织。【原文：Iran-affiliated hackers remain a potential threat to critical sectors of the US economy, including defense contractors and other American organizations, according to a bulletin published Monday from the FBI, the National Security Agency, the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency and the Defense Cyber Crime Center.】

item.title: 贝森特认为目前的收益率意味着长债加息毫无意义
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，从目前的收益率来看，政府加大长期证券的销售力度并不合理，但他希望随着通胀放缓，各期限证券的利率都会下降。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent indicated it wouldn’t make sense for the government to ramp up sales of longer-term securities given where yields are today, though he held out hope that interest rates across maturities will be falling as inflation slows.】

item.title: 新丰泰能源公司因液化天然气合同续约报告而飙升
item.description: 据报道，波多黎各政府同意延长液化天然气供应合同，新堡垒能源公司的股票和债券周一大涨。【原文：New Fortress Energy’s stock and bonds surged on Monday on a report of a contract extension for LNG supply granted by Puerto Rico’s government.】

item.title: 刚果希望在七月与特朗普会晤前与 M23 运动达成和平协议
item.description: 刚果民主共和国希望在两国领导人和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划于下月举行的峰会之前，与卢旺达支持的 M23 叛乱分子达成和平协议。【原文：The Democratic Republic of Congo wants a peace agreement with Rwanda-backed M23 rebels before a planned summit next month between the leaders of the two nations and US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 小规模债券交易员的高流动率对加拿大银行造成冲击
item.description: 在加拿大，银行正在吸引退休的前债券交易员，因为在市场繁忙的时候，高水平的员工流动率动摇了政府金融部门。【原文：Banks are luring former bond traders out of retirement in Canada, as a high level of staff turnover shakes up the government finance sector at a busy time in the market.】

item.title: Circle 狂涨 490% 引发主导 IPO 的银行卖出评级
item.description: 稳定币发行商Circle Internet Group Inc.自本月早些时候首次公开募股以来已经飙升了五倍多，但主承销商摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）的分析师表示，这种涨势已经失控。【原文：Stablecoin issuer Circle Internet Group Inc. has surged more than five-fold since its initial public offering earlier this month, but analysts at lead underwriter JPMorgan Chase & Co. say that the rally has gotten out of hand.】

item.title: 美国暂停加征关税给莱索托纺织业带来些许喜悦
item.description: 美国关税的暂时中止并没有给莱索托的纺织业带来多少缓解，在来自美国的订单枯竭后，莱索托的纺织业已经裁员并关闭了工厂。【原文：A temporary pause on US tariffs has brought little relief to Lesotho’s textile industry, which has suffered layoffs and shuttered factories after orders from America dried up.】

item.title: 葡萄牙距离重启出售国有葡萄牙航空公司（TAP）仅一步之遥
item.description: 在 2023 年出售国有航空公司 TAP SA 的尝试出轨后，葡萄牙正朝着重新出售该公司的方向迈进。【原文：Portugal is moving closer to relaunching the sale of state-owned airline TAP SA after a prior attempt was derailed in 2023.】
